Comment: Pan derung = go hunting.
Only leaders know it.
He gives a short example of how it sounds.
Ceremony for men: Mi'er renga; a ceremony to protect the clan. There is no special ceremony for women. Mi'er renga refers to products from nature.

Hota' tawan mean: ceremony before planting corn and rice. The ground is sprayed with coconut water, then the corn is planted. The place where they spray is called ro'ok, or o'o'. Before harvesting there is no special ceremony. Planting ubi has no special ceremony.
The old village
The Kedang have a special relation with elephants. When they speak to them, the elephant listens.

44 kampongs in Kedang, They all derive from one ancestor called Uye Lewun. This is the name of the mountain that is surrounded by 44 Kedang villages. Uye Lewun is a woman, and her descendants are Ome Suri (female) and Buya Suri (male). These two children then have children and these become the 44 kampongs. The specific family tree goes like this from the very beginning: Uye Lewun (female; the mountain was named after her) has a son Raya Uyo, he has 4 children, Pitang Raya > Kedang, Mau Raya > Timor (where there are Mau clans), Ama Raya > Adonara, Ua Raya > Pantar Alor. From Pitang Raya it goes like this: he has a child Pulo Pitang, he has two children Ome Suri and Buya Suri, and they got children, and these are the Kedang people. This is why they are subdistricts (kecamatan) Ome Suri and Buya Suri. The mountain was not there at first, but ancestors came with a ship that got stuck on a rock, and a bird sat on top of the pole of the boat and was shot, one wing broke. It became a rock, this is why the mountain looks like a bird with one spread wing and one broken wing. Kedang people are said to come from Sina Puel Sana Matang. (Unclear what it refers to.)
Imang
tuak, arak; medicine from roots of trees e.g. tehe'.
In Leu Tuan.

Cut the umbilical cord (=keteng teing), after 3 days wash hair (=peda hamur). Mother stays inside for 30 days; everything is washed after 30 days and mother can go outside to bathe at the well (=pan bahing bula: jalan cuci, go wash). Before birth there is a ritual called Uru'-uru' eban-aur 'tolak alang buka bambu', push away the grass, open the bamboo [blocking the way] > open the way.

When someone old (60+) dies, the gong is hit after he died. So that people hear that someone has died. If the person is younger, no gong is hit. Nowadays normal Islam ritual is followed. In earlier days, the body was given its own little house and put there to decay. This is called Keda weta puli rewa, Aur pulur ta' lolon 'bale-bale - close - put  bury; bale-bale leaf coconut (aur= bamboo). This phrase refers to the bale-bale and the roof, twice.

Cut a chicken, or goat in the Leu Tuan (old village) where there is a stone where they do the ceremony. There is a ritual called Ode iring kuling maleng, Nu neieng wula hau to ask for rain. When the rain is late, this ritual is used. Various objects are put in special places (rocks, metal, copper) and they cut a young coconut and spray the water over the objects. He recites the prayer to ask for wind clouds and rain.
Not in Leubatang. But in Kedang at the coast they do weave. There are two types: Kedang pesisir vs. Kedang pedalaman. The main society is the Kedang pedalaman.
Gong gendang, earlier they also used a mouth instrument, called Ai Likur > from this the name of the village Kalikur (desa kapitang) is derived.

Traditionally the ears of boys and girls were pierced when they were small and the teeth of boys and girls were filed when they became adults. It is called Tuhu' til doro awa 'tusuk telinga asah gigi'.
Women: hair in knot, with a stick (wure') to fix it; the style is called tuhu wure' tusuk tongkat. Men: hair in a horse tail on top of head, with tail hanging loose.
In the ears.
Ivory bracelets (for men), necklace ('bang') out of silver, clay and ivory.
Meba', headpiece from lontar leaves for men. They also have cloth wound around the head (lipa' nodeng, kain lipat). Women don't wear headpieces.
North= tuan laong, South=ana' koda, E=serang gorang, W=abong wara'.
Ile wata bohor beuk > mountain (=N), sea (=S), sunrise (=E), sunset (=W)
Kedang and Lamaholot
Very commonly wife comes from Java, Alor, Baranusa, Adonara, Larantuka.
Also for husband
Also for wife
Indonesian
Bow and arrow, spear, (and penangkis=shield??)
With arrow and spear
Goat, chicken, pig, horse;  buffalo=not anymore, cow=new
the nearest is 500 m from village, the furthest is on the beach
Start planting in the remote places and the gardens near the beach in December when the rain comes; but closer to village they start in October because there the rain is earlier.
Kemiri, coconut, mente, banana; before there used to be lemon but not anymore.

Leu Batang is the name of the village (leu=kampong). It consists of three kampongs; each kampong has one or two clans. The division is: kampong Tiri Lama Bawa has clan Lawetoda and Lemetoda; kampong Batan Lama Doan has clans Aman Utun and Aman Meker; and kampong Noreng has clan Noreng.
One suku is also one marga.
Every clan has a traditional house. Such houses are all called weta riang = house big.
All are at the same level.

The land was previously inhabited, but these people have gone (died, or moved away). Then the Tiri came and settled, then the Batan Lamadoan, then the Noreng. In all cases, there had been previous inhabitants but they had gone and the land was empty.

Only the sons inherit; equally divided. A girl only gets something if the parents give her something before they die, e.g. 1 to 3 coconut palms or kemiri trees. If they do not give her something before they die, girls get nothing.
Only sons inherit. Each son gets an equal share.
Girls inherit nothing.

They are allowed to build a house if they are given the land and get permission from the owner. They cannot buy land. The Kedang traditionally do not sell their land, but if someone needs the money, he can sell some land after consulting the family members, and if they agree.

Men: 17-20+ now,  30+ before. Women: 16-20+now,  30+ before In former days, the rule was 'perkawinan sebaya', = marry someone with the same age. There was also forced marriage; mostly for women. This is the old fashioned way, it was no longer in use when the consultant married sometime in the 1940's.

First the groom's family asks the bride's family for their child. When they do this, hey bring sirih pinang, gong, ivory. They wait 7-8 days to let the bride's family ask the girl if she wants to marry him or not. If she agrees, then her family accepts the sirih pinang and gives it to all their clan members with the news that their daughter is getting married. After that they are married. Marriage can take place in two ways: belis first or marriage first. In the first case they give belis to the bride's family and marry. In the second case, they get married in the government office. Marriage is not allowed inside a suku, or between the suku that form one kampong (see above). The best marriage is between two of the three kampongs in Leubatang.
Not according to tradition, but now they exchange rings.
If the belis is not paid, the groom must 'admit' that he hasn't paid. The debt remains, even if he dies.
After the marriage they stay in the rumah suku 3-7 days. After that they move to stay with the husbands parents, but this is not obligatory, they can also stay whereever they want.
They cannot marry within a clan, or within one kampong in Leubatang. They must marry outside. They can marry the child of the mother's brother because this is another clan.
If father marries again, then they are raised with the stepmother.

It is the best, most optimal marriage but sometimes it is not possible for practical reasons. If there is no such marriage, then the man must pay his mother's brother the belis anyway, even if there is no daughter in that family. If he marries a woman from another family, then  he also has to pay for that woman so in fact he pays belis twice.
This is not possible at all.

Restrictions on locality as well as suku,because suku are divided in kampongs. The best marriage is between suku of different kampongs (see previous question); worst marriage is within a suku or a kampong.
They use 'belis' for this. Ivory worth of 150 million (5 gading of 30 million), gong gendang worth of 20 million; there must be 5 or 7 gading or gong.
Pengimbang', it must be about the same price as the belis. It consists of kain sarong (wela); bracelet (mawang), kain tenun, and silk from India.
In the valleys.
Now they also gather in the mosque and kantor desa. But traditionally they gather in Leu Tuan (=kampong lama). This is an old village located 200 m from Leubatang.
Bale-bale shape, raised platform on four poles.
Storage of e.g. corn, gading, etc.
Each clan has one leader. It must be someone who is "Rian meker a'e ame" (=big eldest kakak father): the eldest son of the previous leader, who must be married and have children.
Demong Paji: war between Kedang people who fight about borders. No war with outsiders.

There are Kedang people near the sea: Wela, and in the mountains: Watan. The belis is more expensive for the Wela. The ritual practices are the same, the only difference is in the words they use for the formula.
The kepala suku is not a king.

Before there used to be slaves. These were often newcomers or those whose ancestors are not known and not part of the clan and therefore have no rights. They can be caught and sold, to those who want them. E.g. when a couple has no children they can buy a boy or girl. This was still practiced when the consultants grandfather was a child (1850's) but after that it stopped.
Kedang-Marica: use coconut and drink the water but cannot take it home. If Kedang eat from Marica's fish, the Marica are not allowed to touch it anymore. Kedang-Lamaholot: no war.
Belan bayan is the name of the alliance between Kedang-Marica. Uwa raya=Marica + Alor; Pitang raya= Kedang, It is a brotherhood relation.
The first 30 days a child has no name yet and is called Ana muhun= child red, 'baby'.
Children are named after father. E.g. Dalan - Daud - Lawetoda: Dalan is personal name child, Daud is name of his father, Lawetoda is name of clan.
Father's name is used.
Kedang was originally called Edang.
Napang nanger is used for all the foreigners.
